snippet: Mismanagement at the now-bankrupt New York City Opera led it to raid its endowment to pay off its huge deficits.
abstract: James B Stewart Common Sense column; many people may be responsible for sad fate of New York City Opera, which filed for bankruptcy after years of mounting deficits, but fate of endowment established to ensure its existence in perpetuity is a stark measure of management failure; City Opera board, with approval from then-New York State Atty Gen Andrew M Cuomo, raided $51.6-million fund to pay huge deficits.
lead_paragraph: Mismanagement at the now-bankrupt New York City Opera led it to raid its endowment to pay off its huge deficits.

headline.print_headline: A Ransacked Endowment At New York City Opera
